result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Earl Harris Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 11 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $543 costs, consecutive to this sentence but concurrent with 15CM1605.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert Earl Harris in court in custody with attorney Jason Mitchel Daane.  Gwanny J Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea, Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders 90 days Rock Co Jail with Huber, concurrent with 15CM1605; 11 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $543 costs, consecutive to this sentence but concurrent with 15CM1605; 65 days sentence credit.

Defendant Robert E. Harris in court in custody with attorney Jason Mitchel Daane.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court, jury trial to be set.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Absolute Sobriety
